text: Bottle shared at muckfest. The beer is a murky brown with no head. Strong chocolate covered raspberry notes in the aroma. Sticky sweet. Like old lady strawberry candies, but the raspberry ones. Big body and low carbonation.
Bottle thanks to ogglethorpe. Pours a cloudy brown with small beige head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is strong berry, pure sugar, booze. Jammy, berries, earth, bitter, boozy, good.

bottle at Muckfest 2017. String fruit and booze. Light oxidation. Dried fruit. Raisins. Reddish brown pour. Small off white head. Strong cherry and fruit flavor. Dried fruit. Lots of dry fruit. Almost astringent. Evaporating. Ok.

A lot of raspberries in aroma. Taste is strong bock at the beginning, which later on turns into fruit beer with raspberry sourness. Made me feel that I had 2 different beers in one sip. Very interesting. Strong beer good for a summer evening.
Keg at ECBF. Murky brown. Nose is big bourbon barrel, sweet vanilla, raspberry. Tastes big tart raspberry, sweet caramel, less barrel than nose.

Tap at Mellow. Sending this one out to Hamilton and Mikkel on the re-opening of Mikkeller Tokyo! With you all in spirit and wish you the best of luck. Anyway on with the rating. Pours a clearish, deep copper with pinkish purple highlights and a finger of off-white head that lingers. Huge raspberry glaze nose. Deep cacao chocolate, black forest cake with jammy raspberry. Cacao nib, faint coffee, more chocolate & raspberry jam. Wonderful in small doses shared amongst friends and family.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Bardzo ciężkie, mulące, alkoholowe, odczucie w stylu malinowego, zagęszczonego syropu.

Draught at Row 34, 2/22/17.Dark chocolate with a ruddy, dark amber tint, quite murky and topped by a tan head that is medium-sized but steadily fades to a ring.Cocoa, poignant raspberry acids and strong caramel backing it comprise the aroma which lends more vanilla as it warms and is surprisingly free from any overbearing alcohol. Definitely hints of sharpness here and there but its folded in to the bright fruit acidity and probably soaked up by the strong maltiness. Doesnt come off fudgey/cakey, though, and the chocolate notes blend with light roast and a spicy pepper character from the raspberry seeds to produce an interesting, complex nose.In the mouth its certainly rich, malty and quite sweet at times, though theres ample, engaging carbonation and strong acidity from the fruit to help break up/balance the malt. Warming finish with light roast, dark chocolate and light ash and vanilla. Huge and malty, but it doesnt feel overly sugary/cakey/underfermented like many of the adjunct stouts in a similar class. Good for dessert and actually drinkable.

37.5 cl bb 03/12/17. Pours deep mahogany with a ruby glint. Thin but enduring disc of espresso-like cream on top. Smell is raspberry, molasses and a bit of dark chocolate. Big front taste of raspberries with cream, turning to some molasses, citrus zest and just a touch chocolate. Finish spotlights more of a tart slant on the raspberries along with some wood and dried grass. Well disguised abv in this heavy bodied brew. Almost-medium fizz provides a welcome tongue tingle, yet remains pretty smooth. Starts sweet but the raspberries linger after only a few sips with a tart astringency that keeps the huge malts in check quite nicely.
From a 375 ml bottle. Pours a murky brown with a thin tan head. Intense raspberry aroma. Flavors of raspberries and chocolate. This one tasted a little off to me. Not quite a drain poor, but close.

Bottle from McHughs. Pours brown with tan head. Aroma is thick luscious raspberry, bread, jam. Hints of alcohol behind the raspberry. Flavour is luscious raspberry with a sour bitter finish. Leather notes. Fantastic .
Aromas loads of raspberry and dark malt. Flavors like nose. Great body and long bitter tart raspberry finish. Hides strength.. Good stuff.
Quite dry, with low carbonation. Sour but fruity. Brown and pink color. Small head. Worth a try.

Nieprzejrzyste, ciemnobrunatne, w aromacie dominuje malina, taki trochę mdły aro,at jak zw lambiku. W pierwszym kontakcie cierpkie i owocowe, dominuje malina ale taka kwaskowata. Później wchodzi słodycz pochodząca zarówno od ciała słodowego jak i od owoców. Na koniec czuć ciepło rozchodzące się w przełyku i w żołądku.
375ml bottle shared at Uiltje bar. Hazy reddish purple with a subtle pink head. Full syrupy body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Raspberries, malts and booze. Very good.

Pours ruby with whitish head. Aroma of raspberries, fruit cake, booze. Flavour just the same even though the alcohol is well hidden. Too thin body and watery for this beer and poor in flavour. Disappointed.

Pours cloudy reddish chestnut, medium tan head, good lacing. Aroma is over the top raspberry. Flavor is quite sweet, light tartness, mega fruity, some bready, burnt toffee malt. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Weird.

From 375cl bottle. Pours dark, with plum color and very limited pinkish foam. Aroma is very fruity and rich: plum, cherries. Body is dense, lots of stickiness and quite some astringency. Taste has sine sweetness, quite some acidity. Finish is long and pleasant. In summary, a great beer.
Sweet tart and bready. Seeet n sour jam and molasses and malt. Heavy though the abv seems lower than 13%. Unique for sure, though pretty expensive.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Weihnachtskalender von Mikkeller). Undurchsichtiges Schwarzbraun mit dichter Schaumkrone im Glas. Sehr dominanter Himbeerengeschmack in Nas und Mund. Sehr ungewöhnlich.

Dimmig brun öl med inslag av rött. Lättare beige skum. Doft och smak av karamell, hallon, alkohol och lätt kryddighet. Tycker inte att hallonen går riktigt ihop med övriga smaker och alkoholen är något för påtaglig.
This one packs a punch. Aromas and flavors of raspberry, dark fruits, molasses and malt. Low hop profile. Pretty color and a weighty palate.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, honey, berries, raspberry, hops, tart and citrus.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown beer with a medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, honey, berries and raspberry; ends medium bitter, dry and sour with hops, tart and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. There is so much going on in this beer. Even slightly feels off, but maybe that is simply part of it. At the same time very sweet and fruity, as well as have a super great finish.
bottle. deep mahogany with small head. tart and sweet with loads of raspberries. malty base. moderate booze. very good.

My Bottom Line:
Raspberry jam and cherry pits galore rise from this decadently fruity dessert, leading to discreet acidity and even more sugar.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A lofty head of foam covers the reddish darkness.
-The nose has an uncanny resemblance with Kuhnhenns Raspberry Eisbock. Thats a great thing, by the way.
-The finish is a tad lazy. Could see a touch more fruity acidity and length there.
-The carbonation is appropriately soft and fluffy.
-All that being said, this is a very successful dessert beer. Memorable stuff.

Bottle.
(Tap) clear, bright, very dark brown colour with a medium tall, brown head; aroma of raspberries, jam; thick palate; balanced flavour with a long, light tart finish

Brown with a small beige head. Aroma is sugar, honey, caramel, chocolate, raspberry, apples, grapes, some vineagar and floral notes. Taste is raspberry, grapes, prunes, lemon, passion fruit, sugar, honey, some mint and chocolate. Sour and sweet aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2016 from tap at mikkeller bar cph. darker beer. definitely a wow effect. malty in the start with caramel taste then goes to the sour and fruity raspberry. low/medium carbontion. 0.2 cl is definitely enough of sourness...

375ml bottle from private import, I think. Aroma: really unpleasant cooked vegetables, rotten fruits, old raspberries, cheap red wine. Ouf. App: murky dark purple, medium off white purple-ish head leaving good lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, loads of rotten raspberries, dry moderate acidity finish. Overall: this is just disgusting. Cant believe all the previous ratings. Wonder if this was made by some nobody it would be rated that high. I feel like puking every time I smell this so call beer. Dp.

Tasted about year ago, bottle. 
It was one of WOW beers. The flavor of raspberries effected by well maturation makes this brew almost like port-wine. Tartness well combined with malt thickness and fruity kick in my nose. Must have brew.
Dark red pour. Strong raspberry and big raspberry flavor with some malt very sweet. A lot of fruit flavor. Thick palate. High anv  is well hidden.
Bottle at Zwanze Day 2016 in Elkader, IA. Dark dense pour with a frothy beige head. Dark sweet malt, sour raspberry on taste. ABV well hidden. Excellent!
Tap at Scheras for Zwanze day. Dark brown pour. Boozy raspberry aroma. Taste is tart raspberry up front, cant believe this is 13%. Unbelievable good....awesome!

Bottle. Dark brown nearly black body with brown head. Aroma is raspberries with raspberries and some raspberries there is also some malts in the background with hints of alcohol. Taste is also raspberries with nice sourness and some malts. Aftertaste is fruity sour with low bitterness.

Bottle at home. Dark ruby-brown pour with a tall, fine-grained tan head. Rich smell, including raspberries, chocolate, espresso, green walnuts, macerated fruit. The taste is quite complex, though a bit unbalanced between fruit tartness and bitter-sweet roasty chocolate. Medium body, low carbonation, velvety texture and a light sour and bitter-sweet finish.
Dark ruby color with medium red-beige head. Aroma is caramel, alcohol, dark fruits. Taste is tart, very fruity, raspberries, alcohol, funk. Sweetsour aftertaste, medium body and medium carbonation.
Draft at Whole Foods PM. Hazy ruby pour with minimal head. Nose was tart raspberries, mild funk, yeastiness. Tasted hefty on the tongue, heavy raspberry, some tartness, late heat.
Aroma: Imp stouts sajaukts ar avenīti. ievārījumīgs. smaro kā būs zepte un cukurs. Gara: Garo arī kā imps ar aveņu, ķiru sīrupu.

A 375ml bottle with a best before date of 22nd September 2016. Poured into a dAchouffe tulip glass. It poured a dark brown colour with a slight red hue. It had a two finger khaki head with good retention that eventually settles to a cap and leaves nice spotty lacing. Aromas are strong raspberry juice and raspberry jam with cherry, grape juice and red wine with maybe a hint of chocolate. Tastes tart raspberry juice, grape juice, mixed berries, plum and red wine. Theres a hint of chocolate and molasses in the middle, but otherwise, its very fruit juicy. Medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation and a well hidden 13% abv. Overall nice tart fruit aromas and taste, as well as hints of chocolate which made it seem like a dessert.

Bottle. The pour is brown with a red tint. The aroma is a raspberry sour funk. The taste has a bunch if raspberry. Not much to the triple bock style. Decent though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Tom. Reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma of forest berries, strawberries, caramel, chocolate. Sweet-sour, nice fruity and berries flavors, notes of vanilla, prunes and chocolate. Medium bodied, smooth and oily mouthfeel. Great.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom L place. Thanks Tom. Opaque red with brownish head. The aroma has lots of raspberry, cherry, milk chocolate and coffee. Sourish flavor with notes of berries, cherry and citrus, salty. Smooth, full-bodied. Excellent.

13.1%ABV.  Trippelbock.

Poured out black-burgundy.  The color of congealed and dried blood or the contents of a boudin noir.  40ºSRM.

Nose has smoke, dark malt sweetness, and the candy sweet fruitiness of a Jolly Rancher candy.

Mouthfeel is soupy and almost syrupy.  Palate has immediately competing taste experiences:  dark bread, roasted malt sweetness, the roasty flavors of a bock and the sweet alcoholic, and medicinal and herbal flavors of a Belgian tripel and the sweet fruitiness of a raspberry compote.

Finish is clean.  This is wondrous given the ponderous grain bill that produced this soupy feeling brew.
Again the overall impression with this is like drinking a prune-grape or a cherry-pear nectar, something fruity  and unfiltered.  

Goes on Favorites List!

At a tasting, many thanks,-almost no head, black color with burgundy red hues, dominant raspberry aroma bursting from the glass with hints of wood nut and caramel, flavor of raspberries and chocolate, mellow sourness and a light balancing maltiness. Excellent.

Bottle 375ml @ Geokkjer
Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma has notes of malt, raspberries, caramel and some tartness. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, light bitter and light sour with a long sweet, raspberry, caramel and light sour finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. A brown beer, hazy looking, and with a dense light tan head on top. Theres lots of raspberry in the aroma, with toffee and some dark chocolate. Nuts and some coffee. Lots of raspberry in the flavor too, with coffee, chocolate and toffee in the back. And of course some warning alcohol. Full body and a smooth carbonation. Sort of sweetish. Hints of cherry pits in the finish. A fine brew, but I guess it would have been better without the raspberries. 160409

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of caramel, some raspberries, malt, some grapes and grains. Flavor is sweet and sour raspberries with some caramel, grains, malt and chocolate. Medium to full body, soft carbonation.

Pours a dark mahogany brown with fluffy tan head. Aromas of raspberry, chocolate, and a touch of barrel funk. Flavors of raspberry, chocolate tootsie roll, and some good sour barrel. This one poured chunky.

375 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 12/3/2017. Pours nearly opaque dark brown/black color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice dense soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big juicy/tart raspberry, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, molasses, chocolate, toasted brown bread, cherry, plum, red grape, red wine, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt, raspberries, and moderate fruity yeast notes; with great strength. Taste of big juicy/tart raspberry, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, molasses, chocolate, toasted brown bread, cherry, plum, red grape, red wine, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Moderate fruity/acidic tartness and tannic bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of juicy/tart raspberry, caramel, brown sugar, molasses, chocolate, toasted brown bread, cherry, plum, red grape, red wine, and yeast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, raspberries, and moderate fruity yeast flavors; with a great malt/bitter/tarness balance; with a light amount of tannic astringency after the finish. Good amount of dryness from acidity and tannic bitterness as well. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, acidic/tannic, and lightly creamy/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding fruited Eisbock! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, raspberries, and moderate fruity yeast flavors; and very smooth and dangerously easy to sip on for the huge ABV. This has more in common with a strong red wine/fruit beer than an eisbock overall; but still has a nice amount of malt complexity in the background to support the strong fruity flavors. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle Pours cloudy reddish chestnut, medium tan head, good lacing. Aroma is over the top raspberry. Flavor is quite sweet, light tartness, mega fruity, some bready, burnt toffee malt. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Weird.

Flaska från Helsingör Vinhandel. Lyxöl på uppståndelsedagen. Mörkröd, lätt disig vätska med tunn vitrosa skumkrona. Doft av hallonsaft och hallonsoda. Något större kropp. Ganska stor beska i inledningen som går jämsides med hallon och hö. Lätt syrlig. Besk avslutning. Liksom med Monks Brew Red/White Wine + Raspberry hade jag hoppats på en större friskhet och syrlighet från hallonen. Även här blir det väldigt bittert och beskt.

Bottle, from Cotteridge, ages ago. Sludgy brown. Minimal head. Nose is thick, sweet, raspberry jelly. Raspberry compote. Dark chocolate. Caramel brittle. Some light, citric notes. Touch of vanilla. Smells fantastic. Taste is tangy, fruity, bittersweet. Never have I rated a beer before, that the term bittersweet suited so well. Palate is silky smooth. Crisp and clean, with a light acidity. Never feels 13%. Bittersweet, fruity finish. Juicy, tangy, tasty gear. Nice one.

Tap at Uiltje bar, Haarlem (rated with a cold..). Dark with a small white head. Aroma of tart raspberries, malts. Taste is tart, moderate bitter, light sweet, raspberries, malts, aftertaste of tart raspberries. Not bad. Love to taste this again without a cold...

On tap at Christian Firtal. Deep red, near black with a small off-white head. Aroma of raspberry with licorice and caramel. Sweet and tart raspberry flavour with licorice. Not in any way what you would expect from a beer named bock, but its really tasty.

sample, poured a murky brown colour with a deep rad shade. nose has sweet red fruits, raspberries, and sweet amarena cherries, sweet caramel, and sweet toasted caramel malts, toffee, and sweet cacao, slight alcohol notice in the finish.

Bottle @ mogala3 festival, Vilnius. Pours dark brown with reddish tones. Aroma: chocolate, roast, berries, raspberry. Taste: Medium + sour, spicy, rasbperries, toffee, sulphur hits your stomach.Medium + body. Dry- sour finish. Nice.

Impressive brew. Lovely jammy thick raspberries, dried fruits, caramel, some toasted malts, toffee, bit citrus, even some choco. Mostly sweet with light tartness and light bitterness. Solid highly enjoyable sipper

HALLELUJAH!!!! Der Geruch heftig fruchtig, so riechen also im Brauprozess verwendete Himbeeren. Aber auch angenehm unangenehm nach Ammoniak!? Der Geschmack dann ganz klar weinlastig und die hierfür charakteristische Säure fügt sich wunderbar ins völlig durchgeknallte Gesamtbild. Hut ab Herr Mikkeller. Für alle Bierfreaks die gerne mal über den Tellerrand schauen. Aus den Mikkeller Bottle Shop in Kopenhagen. 0,375l Flasche für ca. 13 Euro.

Bottle. Fruity aroma of citrus, blackcurrent and raspberry with malty notes of caramel and chocolate. The flavours starts sweet but turns very sour in the finish. Lingering fruity acicity and a light alcohol warmth. The body is medium and the texture is juicy. Average carbonation. I like it...

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Botella. @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 14/01/2016
Color negro, aromas frambuesa, malta, sabor dulce, frambuesa, rica pero mucha cantidad se hace pesada.

Big intense raspberry tartness. To be honest the first few gulps were sharp and difficult but my palate adjusted. These is some toffee sweetness in there and plenty of fruity, lambic tang but overall this is raspberry and booze. Not bad.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Dark brown eith a beige head. 
Sweet aroma with dark toffee and raspberries. 
Sweet flavour with loads of raspberries that give a slightly tart touch.

Bottle, in my fathers kitchen, just now. 
Pours a deep reddish brown with a big tan head that has a sort of pinkish hue to it. 

The aroma has some sweet & toasty malt with a distinct alcohol character, the raspberry is predominant & sweet smelling but without much brightness.

The flavor is big on seedy tart raspberries and big big booziness. There is some nutty, chocolaty, and caramel like malt & the beer is sweet just short of cloying. Man, that raspberry flavor is great, but I cant handle the huge booziness of this one.

bottle @ home. aged one year. Pours a dark brown liquid and a large, long lasting beige head and cloying lacings. Dry, boozy aroma with a sweet, intense raspberry character in nice balance with nuts, background caramel and malt sweetness. Although the booze is quite sharp it integrates well with the sweet raspberry.Taste is very dry, with sour raspberry, spices, background nuts, and maltiness, lemon. Tart/astringent finish with lingering raw alcohol notes and lemon.

Botella 37.5 cl del lupulo, tomada en el momento en Oviedo 06..12..2015. (r118). Color oscuro casi negro con espuma beige que desaparece casi por completo al poco. Aromas ácidos y afrutados dominantes. Sabores de Maltas tostadas con gran dosis de frutas silvestres. Bastante buena. Para repetir sin duda.

Sehr fruchtiger, natürlicher Geruch. Im Antrunk neben den Himbeernoten malzig, milde Säure. Dabei gibt das Malz erstaunlich schnell der Säure nach, selbst die Fruchtigkeit ist in weiten Teilen stärker, was angesichts der 13% ungewöhnlich ist. Würzig, leicht steigend säuerlich, kurzer, eher trockener Nachhall. 11/11/12/8/10/11

Robe brune, mousse peu abondante. Nez puissant qui allie des notes de framboise à des épices, du malt et un coté caramélisé. Bouche à lattaque acidulée sur la framboise, amertume présente, matière imposante et finale longue et amère. Une bière puissante mais qui reste équilibrée. Pour les longues soirées dhiver au coin du feu.

Flaska från SB. Ca ett år gammal. Mörkt rödbrun vätska. Söt och djup lite mörk doft av hallon/hallonsoda/hallonsylt. Söta hallon och söta hallon som funkar riktigt bra med det kraftiga och söta grundölet. Hallonkärnorna och hallonsötman är riktigt fin. Ingen alkohol sticker ut. Men kanske inte riktigt lika bra som Kuhnhenns ikoniska och det är svårt att inte tänka på det att detta i all sin egen storhet är en kopia. Gast visst borde man kunna göra en bra riktigt kraftig hallonbock utan att skämmas. för det.... Riktigt gott iaf.
Dyp rød med rødbrunt høyt skum. Kraftig fruktig lukt, sure kirsebær, bringebær, jordbær og noe trevirke og noe lær. Smaker syrlige, sure røde bær, alkohol.
Sample at SBWF 2015. Hazy brown with a low head. Malty, with a distinct raspberry flavor.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 29A). Bottle 37.5 cl - Batch unknown (BBF 22/09/16). AROMA: strong spicy alcohol aromas with a balanced raspberry background and a faint malty sweet note. APPEARANCE: dark ambar color with ruby highlights and almost clear. average light brown head with good retention for the style and alcohol strength. TASTE: strong raspberry flavour overpowering the base beer style. very faint malty sweetness. low bitterness with a dry, acidic and almost astringent finish. PALATE: medium-full body with moderate carbonation. some astringency present. smooth alcohol warmth. OVERALL: a stronger version of a doppelbock with the addition of raspberry that dominates the base beer and with some astringency that stays on the aftertaste.

375ml bottle from Brewdog.com. Pours a deep dark reddish brown. Not entirely sure the sweet, sticky raspberry works alongside the thick malty boozy mouthfeel. Cloying, heavy and just too sweet. Not for me.

Tap at Mikkeller Tokyo. Interesting. Aroma is raspberry and maybe a bit of caramel sweetness. Sweet raspberry hit, quite fresh. Then sweetness and booze. Surprisingly easy drinking. Toffee too. Quite a strange one, but I think I quite like it. Taste has a touch of vegetables in some sips though which is a little off-putting.

(375ml 2014 bottle from Systembolaget) Pours a dark reddish brown with a small persistent tan head and lace. Aroma raspberry juice and preserves, fruitcake with hints of bread/nuts/spices, sherry, toffee. Palate is sweet/tart with intense raspberry flesh/preserves, toffee, black currant jam, lemon juice, a dry dusty earthy malt undertone. Finish quite tart/acidic, some lingering malt, alcohol heat. Medium body with light carb. I was expecting this to be cloyingly sweet and fruity but its actually quite bitingly tart instead. Lacks complexity though, the fruit totally dominates and it could actually use more malt presence.
Draught at Mikkeller Tokyo.Really dark ruby with no head. Vibrant raspberry aroma. Really sour raspberry flavour with a dry wood finish. Can hardly believe its 13%!
How : bottle Appearance : dark red, minimal off-white head. Aroma : dark berries, dark caramel, lime, spice and sherry. Palate : full body, smooth carbonation.
Pours dark red brown with no head. Very strong fruity aroma, and alcohol. I would really liked to like this, but it was a bit to much like wine.

Bottle 375ml. [ As Mikkeller Raspberry Trippelbock ].Clear dark red brown color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, raspberry, sweet matl, sugary. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, light to moderate acidic and moderate bitter with a long duration, raspberry, tart, sugary, berry bitter, moderate blackcurrant, dry. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20150513]
Melkebaren 240215. Dark orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is raspberry, fruit, caramel. Flavour is malt, raspberry, fruit, caramel, alcohol. Full body. Very nice beer.

12.7 oz. green bottle poured into a glass. Dark brown with medium brown highlights and small beige head. Aroma is nice raspberry, medium body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is dark malt and some raspberry.
Bottle. Pours dark amber brown tan head. Nose/taste of raspberry, jam, dried strawberry ice cream and light toffee - medium body.
Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Joes. Dark red color, tan head. Aroma is fruity, strawberry. Taste has a bit too much strawberry for my liking. Still quite decent though.

Bottle @ benzai. Dark amber to ruby colour with a small beige head. Smells strawberry, red fruit, sweet, ice cream nice. Tastes berries, fruity, slightly sour, jive icecream/popsicle. Medium to full body, soft carbo.

Roxa escura, totalmente opaca, espuma marrom, de bom lacing, duradoura. Aroma de framboesas, morangos, frutas vermelhas, bastante alcoólica, deliciosa! Paladar de dulçor médio, leve amargor, corpo licoroso, leve carbonação. Se tivesse seguido o aroma, seria quase perfeita ... aftertaste tem um pouco da acidez de suco de frutas, persistente, novamente frutas vermelhas, final levemente seco.

One of the closer bottles of Wednesday .. Has a nice jamminess to it, dark heavy malt and syrup .. Mouth is quite thick, warning finish .. Actually hides the abv quite well .. . . I really need to find a dancehall! Riddim!

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget. Had at a tasting 2015-04-18.
Appearance: Dark amber colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Raspberries, citrus, some vanilla, alcohol.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Raspberries, alcohol, caramel, vanilla, fruit.

Bottle at home. Dark amber almost brownish beer with a beige head. Raspberry, chocolate, malty aroma, mal with vanilla notes. Similar flavour with some earthy notes. Lovely raspberry taste, maybe a little to much alcohol taste.

Rødlig klar skum brunlig tæt lang 
Hindbær varm sukker solbær
Bitter modrate sød meget sur lidt 
Cremet blød tør 
@f1

Thanks to tderoeck for picking up this beer for me. 375 ml. split with Kraddel. The name brought up instant associations with Kuhnhenn Raspberry Eisbock but sadly this isnt anything like that beer. Pours an incredibly dark pomegranate wine ruby, blackish hued, patch mocha head. Nose is big raspberry jam but mixed with a weird, acetone, alcohol, sourish lemon, light nail polish, a weird mix, Taste carries same weird cleaning agent lemon sourness, acidic with boozy sweet raspberry jam, lightly weirdly soapy, caramel sweet, enjoyable but this flavours dont really mix & they take away from the raspberry jam. Body is thick but feels a bit thinner than expected and some acidic streak in it. Bit of an interesting & rather unique mess.

Thnx to ships. pours very dark redbrown. OK foam , that is like mocha-white. Smell is sweet, raspberry syrup. Taste is intense raspberry , sharp, natural, bit bitter. Bit earthy raspberry. Sweet, very thick. Bit to high carbo for my taste. Tastes like super intensified raspberries. No other aspects rise to the surface. The lack of complexity kinda bothers me.... Good, but not great- which I was kinda hoping for ...

Bottle.
Clear Dark caramel color, small tan head.
Sweet fruity Nose, sweet taste with a clear raspberry taste.
Medium body, soft carbonation.
Høj procent sød trippel bock. Frugtig øl lidt hindbær. Det er en dele øl til en festlig lejlighed
Bottle. Clear reddish pour with tan head. Aroma has intense raspberry. Quite sweet. Taste has some sweetness. Very fruity

375ml bottle from Saveur-Biere. BBE 22/09/16.


Dark stuff with a light beige head. Sweet & sour, lot of raspberry, strong slow sipper. Good nightcap.

Elle est de couleur brune très foncé avec de léger reflets rubis a peine versé sans avoir le nez dans le verre on sent déjà le bouquet des fruits rouges.
Au nez on va sentir des arômes de fruits rouges séchés on sent la cerise la fraise la framboise et peut-être aussi un peu la mûre.
En bouche par contre cest sûr on sent la mûre distinctement on sent aussi les fruits des bois on peut sentir aussi la présence dalcool 
(normal car cette bière titre quand même 13 degrés, ce qui est énorme pour une bière au fruit rouge) mais au final on est un peu déçu par rapport à lodeur qui en sort
 personnellement elle fait partie de mes bière aux fruits rouges préféré!!

Das Bier ist sehr dunkel braun, fast schwarz und es hat eine ordentliche beige Schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen Himbeeren, trocken, leicht alkoholisch. Geschmack nach vergorenen reifen Himbeeren, alkoholisch, kräftig malzig.
Crazy raspberry madness. Possibly best fruit beer Ive had. No tasting notes for this one, had it as part of the Mikkeller Ol Og Brod six course tasting menu in Copenhagen.
Fad: Brunorange let diset med et stort skumhoved. Fantastisk duft af sure hindbær, men den store maltsødme bakker bærrene flot op. Virkelig en overraskelse af de gode. Dejlig øl.

March 27, 2015. Bottle at home, best before august 22, 2016. 
Murky dark red with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet and light tart raspberry jam, some caramel and alcohol. Taste is tart raspberries, bitter roasted notes and alcohol which make it hard to drink. This didnt work at all for me...

Pours a very dark reddish brown with a large frothy off white head. Aromas of raspberry jam, caramel, oak, burnt sugar, slight funk. Taste is raspberry jam, caramel, burnt sugar, roasted honeyed berries. Mouthfeel is full bodied with an oily visous feel.

Pours deep brown with a small tan head. Aroma is molasses, fermented dark fruits, tangy raspberry and heavy malts "from the deep". Taste is tart raspberry and bitter 80%< cacao. The tang from the raspberries runs throughout the palate from beginning to finish. Nice. The overall impression from this one is raspberry sourness until those chocolate flavors do their little hide-n-seek thing.

37,5cl bottle at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a dark, deep, clear red-brown with a medium sized, off white head. Aroma has toasted malts, big, juicy raspberry, jam and some vinous notes. Taste is very tart up front with lots of raspberry. Dry red wine notes, slight malty sweetness, very intense and surprising, since i thought this would be very thick and sweet. Full, but again not sticky thick body and an average carbonation.

Dark brown colour with beige and slightly reddish head on top. Aroma has lots of raspberry and some dark chocolate but the berry is really overpowering. Taste has lots of raspberries, sweet dark malts, chocolate and some sourness. Full body and high carbonation. Alcohol stayed away in this one and the raspberries kicked one right in the face. A successful brew.

Bottle (375 ml) from Systembolaget. Hezy chestnut, large beige head. Raspberry dominated aroma with some raosted malt, and alcohol. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, some acidity clashing with a moderate biitterness. Messy.

On tap @ Melkebaren. Unclear dark orange body with a small, lacing off-white head. Aroma is fruity with raspberry, dry fruit and caramel malt. Flavor is quite sweet malty with dry fruit but also acidic raspberries, red berries and some warming alcohol. The alcohol is actually surprisingly well camouflaged considering the high ABV. Fine body with a fruity aftertaste that becomes slightly more acidic after a while and more warming alcohol. Pretty solid and lot more drinkable than expected.
[2/15/15] Draught at Mikkeller Bar in San Francisco. Black. Huge rasperries yogurt aroma. Sweet-sourish flavor with lots of raspberries and a bit of alcohol. Quite full-bodied. Very good stuff.

Bottle Pours hazy reddish amber with small light pink head. Aroma is very intense! loads og raspberries! Some toasty malts in the background, more balances as it warms. Slight jam and booze. Taste is surprisingly different from what expected! Packed with intense tart raspberries which plays out the high ABV quite well. Bit reminiscent of dry red wine. Malty sweet backbone too and really dry finish with some toasty malt-like mouthfeel. Full body, soft carbonation and warming booze. Dont know about this, but well-executed.

Jäst, malt & jävla massa hallon. Smaken ger lite essens eller juice av hallon snarare än äkta hallon? Kanske en kombination. Lite sliskig hallonsmak iaf med märklig syra i eftersmaken som skulle kunna komma från de äkta hallonen och eller sötman från juicen tillsammans med mörk malt. Speciellt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark red/amber color, nice tan head. Aroma is sweet raspberry and similar fruits, some acidic note. Taste is light sour, tart. Next is sweet raspberry and forest fruits, liqueur and wine notes, also some nice alcohol hint at finish. Aftertaste is tart fruits. Full body, smooth texture, low carbonation. This thing is great, complex, balanced and full of flavors.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Cloudy ruby/dark brown, small head. Caramelly raspberry aroma. Sweet with distinct berry acidity with full body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Tart raspberries dominate totally initially, then diesel and fruit brandy taskes over. Interesting concept, but sketchy one-dimensional performance.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. pours hazy dark reddish brown with a frothy and creamy mocha head that slowly dissipates while leaving some sticky spotty trace on the glass. Smell is sweet, malty and fruity woth toasted malts, dark bread, chocolate, raspberries, hay, cereal, alcohol and lemon zest. Taste is slightly sweet, sour, slightly malty and fruity with roasted malts, caramel, dark chocolate, raspberries, lemon juice, hay, moist soil, alcohol and lemon zest. mouthfeel is round, astringent, tart, boozy and near full bodied. Finish is bitter and sour with roasted malts, raspberries, lemon juice, hay, moist soil, alcohol, toasted cereal and lemon zest. Too bitter, too sour, too astringent. I thought they had aimed for a euro raspberry eisbock. Atleast I hoped they would have. They didnt...

Beczka; barwa brunatna; aromat świeżych słodkich malin, czekolady, kwaśny, likieru alkoholowego, owoców w alkoholu. Smak na początku słodki następnie kwaśny i gorzki. Alkohol rozgrzewa ale poza tym doskonale ukryty. Do tego maliny i karmel. Świetne.

Sample from bottle, from backlog. Near black with a reddish tint with little head. Aroma has loads of raspberry, alcohol, roasted malt and bitter notes. Taste has lots of raspberries, light tart, sweet, dark chocolate, bitter roasted notes with a fruity boozy finish.
Bottle. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma of raspberry jam, slightly medicinal. Taste of tart raspberry, some caramel. Long tart ffinish
Bottle at Craigs. Pours deep ruby, nose is all raspberry jam, taste is tart raspberry, dry, a little sweet, bit one-dimensional but a good dimension.

bottle at home ... deep black... thin tan head ... dark roast ... massive real raspberry jam nose ... dark roast ... dark chocolate ...d eep malts ... soft chocolate ... very sweet .. hint of strawberry aand raspberries ... wow... in a taste sensation

375ml bottle. Very dark red on the verge of black with dense one finger red-ish tinted grey-white head. Lovely aroma of raspberries and raspberry jam with some hints of lightly roasted dark malts and coffee beans as well as some chocolaty sweetness. Very nice and genuine raspberry taste followed by some typical roasted malt flavors as well as a distinctive alcohol bite and warmth. Great, very complex beer - perfect to share.

Draught. Dark colour, almost black. Aroma is like of a non-sweetened raspberry juice. Quite sour. Alcohol does not disturb, which is really impressive considering the beer has 13%. Nice, but you dont feel its a beer.

Draft at the Sybarite Pig in Boca. Small snifter pour was deep crimson with no real head. Aroma was straight up raspberry and raspberry preserves. The taste was serious raspberries that were both slightly tart and sweet at the same time. Some dark chocolate notes as well. Very boozy finish. More like a rasp liqueur.
Dark ruby red colour, nice reddish head. Aroma of candy sugar, raspberries, cherries, nuts, rasins. Taste is medium sweet, light sour. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.

Wonderfull raspberry aroma, dark reddish brown with porter style head. Nice fresh taste, a very complex development with rasberry, sourness and a sweet but dry after taste, if that make sense. The sourness balances out the sweetness and no alcohol taste, just a warm aftertaste.. Really exiting and different and very good. Like it
Mørk brun/svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av frukt og malt. Smak av frukt og malt. Fyldig og frruktig. Søt og noe tørr avslutning. Tap @ Melkebaren.

Lukt: Frisk duft av bringebær og andre frukter.
Utseende: Mørk brun farge, nesten sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Nydelig smak av bringerbær og andre frukter med en syrlig ettersmak.
Hvor: Kjø[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Sandnes sammen med Gorm.

Kommentar: God i mindre mengder, et glass til kveldskosen holder lenge.
Aroma is raspberries, dryish malts and sweetness. The flavor is raspberries/sort of raspberry shortcake, malts, medium sweetness/bordering on cloying and a tart/increasingly warming alcohol finish.

Dank, near black pour - hint of rose on the edges. Little head to speak of. Aroma is malty and full of raspberry..slight sour hint. Flavor is malt and raspberry, and a slightly odd bitterness that comes to play after the sip is complete...not a big detraction, but seemed out of place. Very mild sourness actually adds to the beer. Palate is medium bodied...a bit boozy on the tongue, but nothing over the top given the ABV on this puppy. Enjoyable, but happy for a 5 oz taster of this one, as I think this could get a bit cumbersome in large quantities.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2015 Re-rate at Craigs. One up for looks.

375ml bottle from the Brewdog online shop, shared with jeevan. Pours dark brown, red tinge, thin tan head, lovely lacing. Aromas of faint raspberry jam, caramel, light booze, cream, tar, marzipan. Taste is more cooked fruit, cough medicine, booze heat, dark sugars. Medium body, creamy texture. Slightly boozy finish.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Pours Near black with a rich tan head and a treacle aroma. There is a dark malt flavor that is overwhelmed by raspberry in a good way, since I love raspberries. The high ABV is not evident in the flavor and the finish is just slightly sour.

Bottle @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours very dark amber with a tan head, some alcings. Aroma of malt, caramel, wood, raspberries, sweets. Falvor is rather sweet, malty, wood, rich fresh raspberries, some tartness, a bit boozy. Full body, soft carboantion, light tart finish with some hot alcohol. 220115

On tap @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a dark murky brown body with a medium creamy light beige head. Nose is caramel, raspberries, grains, biscuits, bread dough and hints of toffee and red berries. Taste is tart raspberries, brown bread, caramel, burnt toast and hints of red berries, grains and alcohol. Full body, soft to medium carbonation. Nice, but a bit sharp around the edges in terms of raspberry bite, roastiness and alcohol which Im sure could be integrated better with aging.

Bottle @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Hazy deep redd with a small pink head. Aroma is sweet, malty, dark sugar and heavy raspberry. Flavor is quite sweet, moderate bitter and light acidic. Dry, moderate bitter and light acidic finish with lots of warming alcohol. 220115

Bottle, 13%. Dark brown/red with small beige head. Aroma is malt, raspberries, candy, caramel, toasted with notes of berry stones. Flavour is malt, raspberries, candy, sweet, toasted, berry stones, slightly acid, wood, little oak, warming, notes of alcohol and a little sour.
Bottle @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Nice head with good duraion. Color is ruby. Aroma and taste are rich raspberries, fruits, malt, lactose acid and has a nice raspberry fruity finish. Lovely.

375cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours deep pink with a dark beige head which last well. Well carbonated and together with the thick mouthfeel a nice prospect. Aroma is sour fruit but not exclusively raspberry to me smells like there is some cherry going on in there too. Taste is upfront sweet and really quite sour. Sour cherries, raspberry, coffee and a dusting of coca powder combine to make an almost stout-like fruit beer. Glad I had this in the winter months as it is less of a summer beer as I expected.

@ Havregatan 150117. Bottle (375 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and sweet with loads of raspberries, caramely with notes of liquorice, medium to light full body with an oily texture. The finish is bitter and fruity with raspberries and warming alcohol.
Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy raspberry aroma. Fruity spicy raspberry and caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy raspberry finish.
375ml shared by Jason, thanks! Pours dark amber with a beige head. Aroma is molasses, raspberry. Flavor follows, this is quite syrupy, but quite nice. Reminds me of a good dessert wine.

I have been drinking this before, but just shared it. Now Im testing a 375ml bottle in a Riedel Vinum Shiraz glass, it is dark, blood red in the glass. Aroma is wonderfully sweet and smells of red berries. The flavor is intense, there are lots of raspberry, full body, tart, malt, long taste in the mouth.Very tasteful this one, I must blame myself that I do not have a good dersert available for this beer.

4oz on tap at Ei8ht Ball a few weeks ago. Pours a very foreboding dark red - brown color. Thin ring of off-white head. Decent ridges of lace. I was worried that this would be cloying sweet, but actually this is very pleasantly tart and kind of dry. A lot more raspberry than I expected, which is very appreciated. Huge raspberry, like a mouthful of them. Touch of dark chocolate, dark fruit. Flavor is mostly raspberry. Hint of molasses. Big body, kind of slick, then drying in the finish. Bigger sweet taste, also a big natural raspberry tartness, much more tart than expected. Some bitterness, a touch of medicinal quality. Lighter, kind of soft carbonation. Really interesting, tasty stuff to sip on. Really delivers on the raspberry...
Mörkbrun med stort ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar massor med hallon, lite syrligt och lite alkohol. Fyllig och bra!

Much scent of raspberries. The taste is also very raspberries, which I love. But it is malty, too. To be 13% so it does not feel at all. Really wonderful to drink. Perfect bitterness that fills the mouth for a long while. I am very impressed with this beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Draft sample at Ei8ht Ball pour hazy brown with copper hue. Nose rotten raspberry, sweet malt, butterscotch, toffee. Taste sweet raspberry, malty, and fairly bright flavors. Lighter fruity finish.

31-DEC-2014, bottle @home, from Kihoskh.
Amber with lasting tan head.
Aroma is raspberry. Not much else. Taste is raspberry, loads of raspberry. There are some malty notes underneath like bread and caramel, but mostly this is a raspberry drink. Sweet with low carbonation. Nice but perhaps a bit too sweet.
Dark red with a tiny pink head. Fruity and malty tones. Fruit, malt, spices and bitterness. Full body with a long bitter / sour finish.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; opaque brown appearance, bubbly moccha appearance, taste has some sour fruit, cherry fruit taste, almonds, dark chocolate, Black Forest gateaux, tart berries, Im ok with this.
Bottled:Deep red with a nice head.Aroma is all about raspberries.Tste is also all about raspberries, with some roasty notes added. Warming, somewhat boozy finish.Its a bit one sided, but I liked it.

Color rojizo oscuro con espuma beige densa, duradera y uniforme. intenso aroma de frutos rojos, con fondo débil de aceitunas, y mermelada. Cuerpo denso, inicio acidulce y afrutado intenso, ligera madera y final seco que perdura hasta el regusto.
Mainly raspberry aroma but with some strawberry and blueberries as well, some caramel is present as well. Fruity bit tart taste and a bit salty as well. Very fruity and nice

375ml bottle, pours deep red with a bubbly off white head. Aroma is big on raspberries, with grainy malts, very tart, acidic, finish is sweet and tart. Body is light, texture is slick, carbonation is soft to average. Abv hidden well. Lots of raspberries, lacking in nuance.

375 ml bottle from Party Source at home. Pours a dark cola brown color with a large fluffy beige head that leaves sticky lace. The aroma and flavor have big raspberry syrup, some tartness to it, an alcohol burn as it goes down that is very warming, some caramel, some chocolate, almost a hint of wood to the finish.
On tap at Chmielarnia, Warsaw. Raspberry syrup on nose and in taste. Full body intensive. Alcohol very well hidden. Not a fan of a style but I guess its well crafted. Ppp
330 mml bottle tasted on the 20/12/2014. Cola colour with a tan head. Fruit and acid smell with sweet raspberries. Strong and sweet taste with hit of raspberries and smooth finish. Next one please!

Bottle from Systembolaget. Dark amber/reddish brown beer with a rich beige head. Caramel and raspberry aroma, malty, chocolate, citrus, grape notes, some vanilla. Raspberry and chocolate flavor, warming alcohol, caramel, earthy notes. A bit too boozy.

Tap. Deep Brown body with a creamy, tan head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate and raspberry.Slightly sour flavor that ends up dry and rather tart. Medum bodied. oily texture and soft carbonation. A nice Fruit/ sour.

Day 12 of Julepakkekalender from Mikkeller. Bottled.

Aroma: Smells smiliar to red wine, with a raspberry note.
Appearance: Pours a cola colour, with a light tan head.
Taste: The first sip just punches you in the face! Ouch! It gets better after a few sips. A slightly sweet red wine taste, with a very tart hit of raspberries. A mellow coffee aftertaste.
Palate: A sharp tarty taste, followed by a smooth finish. Medium body. Light carbonation.
Overall: Not my thing at all. It tastes very similar to red wine, and the minimal carbonation doesnt help that. Too tarty, and reminiscent of the vinegar taste found in red wine. A nice coffee aftertaste though.

Bottle from Mikkeller Julepakke kalender. Dark brown body with a medium light brown head. Lots of tart raspberries in the nose, some sweet caramel as well. Tart raspberries, light alcohol burning on the lips, malt, caramel. Different but yet good.

13.12.2014, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is fruity, fresh sweet raspberries, grass, weeds, grain, hay, cereal, berry skin. Taste is fresh fruity, dry sour raspberries, harsh grass, weeds, berry skin, cereal, minerals, grain, alcohol. Medium bitterness, harsh mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle web SB cons 2014-12-12 Göteborg
AR: womit, cherry
Marcus: raspberries
AP: dark ruby, stouthy pinkish beige head
F: cherry, citrus, fudge
Marcus: 4,0
Bottled. A brown beer with a lazing tan head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel and alcohc, leaidng to a bititer finish.

Pitch black with some reddish hues in a bright light. sticky 1 finger head. licorice, spice, cherry berry nose and butterscotch. Taste is pretty bad. raspberry is a nice break but it just tasts bad. the base beer itself is sort of spicy and cheap candy, licorice etc. ugh
37.5 cl. bottle. Reddish colour with an off-.white head. Aroma and flavour of raspberries, malt, caramel, fruit and some bitterness.

37.5 cL bottle. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is raspberry, sulphorish and almondish. Raspberry and sulphorish. Roasted dark malty. Bitter and dry dark malty. Dry finish.

375 ml bottle. Pours a dark mahogany brown colour with a small head. Aroma of rich sweet raspberry notes, some cacao and biscuit. Huge rich flavour of tart ripe raspberries, raspberry seeds, caramel, some salted licorice notes, dark chocolate mousse and warming alcohol. Full bodied. Thick mouthfeel. Alcohol is surprisingly well hidden. A very big beer with a brilliant balance. Raspberry is my sweet spot.

Aroma: Smelling of sour fruits, raspberries and grass.Appearance: A dark redbrown colored beer. A red tan head with good lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting bread, sour apples, raspberries and lemon peel.Palate: Medium carbonation, a coarse texture. A medium body with a dry finish.Overall: A fruity Flemish brown, not bad at all.Note: Bottle 375 ml at home. Reviewed 2014-12-12.

Bottle. It pours very dark brown ruby with a creamy dense cocoa milk colored head. The nose reminds me of Kuhnhenn Raspberry Icebock but with way more malt and chocolate. Like a heavy chocolate dessert with raspberry sauce. The flavor is at first sour and light acidic and then comes the raspberries and the malt with some chocolate notes. Alcohol is mostly felt in the finish. Very nice indeed.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 38cl, as Mikkeller Raspberry Trippelbock, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2014, with raspberries, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex fruit brew, alcoholic/fruity/sweet and slightly sour/roasted, yet not too heavy, balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew, yet expensive!
Dark ruby red colour, nice reddish head. Aroma of candy sugar, raspberries, cherries, nuts, rasins. Taste is medium sweet, light sour. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Interesting

From tap, 150ml @ Szynkarnia, Wrocław. Red-brown colour, small head. Aroma is weak, there is a little bit of raspberry notes and a little bit of caramel. In taste its nice - there is lot of sour and sweet fruity notes mixed with some caramel, tastes almost like wine. Alcohol well hidden, I would not say, that it is 13% abv. Nice, but in small ammounts.

Draught at MikkellerBar. Clear deep dark red/brown - offwhite head. 
Lots of raspberries. Acid. Fruity. Light marzipan. Licorice. Ok malty. Roasted. Bitterness. Some sweetness. Alcho bite in the finish.

10th November 2014Brewdog Shepherds Bush. Keg. Murky deep amber - brown beer, small off white head. Crispy light palate. Very big raspberry jam! Underneath is mild caramel malts, a little citrus and a little floralness. Finishes with more BIG raspberry jam. Tasty.

Keg at BD ShepBush. Dark brown with tan head that fades to a ring, leaving some nice lace. Nose of dark caramel and raspberries, tastes moderate sweet cinder toffee dark caramel malt with big sharp raspberry hit, some bitterness. Light and easy drinking for 13%, fairly soft carb, long raspberry finish. Nice, and certainly interesting, but I think its a bit one-dimensional: the raspberry just drowns out everything else.

@ Mikkeller Stockholm 14-11-8: riktig söt doft. Smaken är fyllig och bärig, ganska söt. Känns lite som att dricka sylt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
---- Soberness not garanteed!

Keg at Brewdog as Raspberry Trippelbock 13%. Dark cola brown, small white head. Aroma is strong raspberry jam, toffee-ish, apple. Body is medium, touch of carbonation, pretty smooth. Taste is earthy, dirty, a little coffee, a touch sour. Salt and vinegar crisps. Ethanol. Decent enough.

Pours deep murky brown with low tan head. Aroma of raspberries, liqeured cherries, light caramel and vanilla, almond icing. Taste is lightly sour and boozy, raspberry and cherry tart, underlying sweetness, sour finish. Body is medium and smooth to sticky with soft carbonation.
37.5 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark reddish brown with an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are raspberries, malt, and alcohol - with a sweet and slightly alcoholic finish.

Keg at BD Shepherds Bush tap takeover. It pours a dark brown color with a medium tan head. Aroma is big bold and sweet with notes of raspberries, rum cherries, wood, dark chocolate, burnt sugar. Taste again very sweet and bold, with more notes of caramel, toffee, vanilla, raspberries, dried fruits, dates, burnt sugar. Finishes sticky and sweet. Overall, the big bold statement type of Mikkeller beer weve all come to know and love

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Dark brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of raspberries with notes of dried fruits and alcohol.
Sweet and fruity flavour of raspberries and alcohol with notes of dried fruits and acidic notes.
Warming alcoholic finish.

On tap at Mikkeller Stockholm. 

Almost black with a minimal head. Sweet and a bit sour with raspberries, malt, berries and some alcohol. The finish was long. A dangerous beer, it reminded of juice.

Keg at Beergeek with Rachel, Nick & Jenny. This was the beer of the night for most and my second raspberry Mikkeller of the day. Pours dark Reddish Brown with an off-White head. Sweet desert raspberries on the nose. Nice blend of raspberries and doppelbock. Quite boozy. A sipper.

Bottle. Deep brown liquid with ruby hue with small to medium off-white head. Aroma of raspberries, pumpernickel, raw sugar, toast, light acetone and dried fruit. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raspberries, sweet alcohol, raw sugar and blackberries. Medium to full bodied with low to medium carbonation and sticky mouthfeel. Not that balanced and a bit hot and also sour in the taste. Still nice though.
Tap at mikkeller and friends. Almost black color, brown head. Aroma is sweet malty, raspberry, butter notes. Sour taste, wheaty notes, big raspberry, yeasty notes.
Fat på mikkeller and friends - ååh underbar. Frisk bärig doft, mörk som natten. Tydlig smak av hallon och den syrliga smaken av bär. Helt underbar!
Väldigt läskande i aromen, mycket syrliga hallon aromer. Kraftig hallon ak, känner av ABV, värmande ;)
